update.description:
This adds `MotionTimerDetachPlugin`, which is derived from `JointMotionTimerPlugin` and disables a robot by detaching joints after a specified amount of time in motion. The default time limit is 20 minutes. To test, apply the following patch to `x2_description` that reduces the time limit to 10 seconds:

~~~
diff -r 915a8a2df644 x2_description/urdf/x2.gazebo
--- a/x2_description/urdf/x2.gazebo     Fri Oct 26 17:31:36 2018 -0700
+++ b/x2_description/urdf/x2.gazebo     Fri Oct 26 17:33:15 2018 -0700
@@ -26,7 +26,8 @@
   </gazebo>
 
   <gazebo>
-    <plugin name="joint_motion_timer" filename="libJointMotionTimerPlugin.so">
+    <plugin name="joint_motion_timer" filename="libMotionTimerDetachPlugin.so">
+      <detach_time_limit>10</detach_time_limit>
       <joint>front_left_wheel</joint>
       <joint>front_right_wheel</joint>
       <joint>rear_left_wheel</joint>
~~~

While driving, you can echo the following topic to keep track of the time, then watch its wheels fall off after 10 seconds:

~~~
ign topic -e -t /X2/elapsed_time_updates
~~~

This makes some slight modifications to `JointMotionTimerPlugin`:

* Add accessors for ElapsedTime and Joints in JointMotionTimerPlugin so derived plugins can access that data

* use new Joints function in OnUpdate

I also exposed an additional debug parameter in competition.launch, which is unrelated but useful.

This would be even better with one of the drones, but one of the plugins in `rotors_gazebo` seg-faults after detaching joints that it is trying to use.
update.title: MotionTimerDetachPlugin: use JointMotionTimerPlugin to disable robot after time limit

pull_request.title: MotionTimerDetachPlugin: use JointMotionTimerPlugin to disable robot after time limit

content.raw:
I think I must be doing something wrong. I've setup a clean workspace, and ran `catkin_make install` a few times. I see:

```
[Err] [Plugin.hh:180] Failed to load plugin libMotionTimerLockPlugin.so: /home/nkoenig/subt_ws/install/lib/libMotionTimerLockPlugin.so: undefined symbol: _ZTIN4subt22JointMotionTimerPluginE

```
for each vehicle.

Here is how I'm running subt:

**Terminal 1**

```
roslaunch subt_gazebo competition.launch
```

**Terminal 2**

```
roslaunch subt_example team.launch
```

pullrequest.title: MotionTimerDetachPlugin: use JointMotionTimerPlugin to disable robot after time limit

content.raw: I just added `MotionTimerLockPlugin`, which locks joint limits instead of detaching. I also added this plugin to our 4 example robots, with 15 minute time limits for the ground vehicles and 10 minute time limits for the drones.
content.html: I just added MotionTimerLockPlugin, which locks joint limits instead of detaching. I also added this plugin to our 4 example robots, with 15 minute time limits for the ground vehicles and 10 minute time limits for the drones.

update.description:
This adds `MotionTimerDetachPlugin`, which is derived from `JointMotionTimerPlugin` and disables a robot by detaching joints after a specified amount of time in motion. The default time limit is 20 minutes. To test, apply the following patch to `x2_description` that reduces the time limit to 10 seconds:

~~~

--- a/x2_description/urdf/x2.gazebo     Fri Oct 26 17:31:36 2018 -0700
+++ b/x2_description/urdf/x2.gazebo     Fri Oct 26 17:33:15 2018 -0700
@@ -26,7 +26,8 @@
   </gazebo>
 
   <gazebo>
-    <plugin name="joint_motion_timer" filename="libJointMotionTimerPlugin.so">
+    <plugin name="joint_motion_timer" filename="libMotionTimerDetachPlugin.so">
+      <detach_time_limit>10</detach_time_limit>
       <joint>front_left_wheel</joint>
       <joint>front_right_wheel</joint>
       <joint>rear_left_wheel</joint>
~~~

While driving, you can echo the following topic to keep track of the time, then watch its wheels fall off after 10 seconds:

~~~
ign topic -e -t /X2/elapsed_time_updates

This makes some slight modifications to `JointMotionTimerPlugin`:

* Add accessors for ElapsedTime and Joints in JointMotionTimerPlugin so derived plugins can access that data

* use new Joints function in OnUpdate

I also exposed an additional debug parameter in competition.launch, which is unrelated but useful.

This would be even better with one of the drones, but one of the plugins in `rotors_gazebo` seg-faults after detaching joints that it is trying to use.
